line_1: Believe me, Rose, howe'er this Con. may please,
line_2: With flowing Numbers, and an easy Phrase;

line_1: With flowing Numbers, and an easy Phrase;
line_2: Believe me, Rose, howe'er this Con. may please,

line_1: With Wit, with Humour, and with ev'ry Art,
line_2: That steals the Ear, and ravishes the Heart;

line_1: That steals the Ear, and ravishes the Heart;
line_2: With Wit, with Humour, and with ev'ry Art,

line_1: Howe'er his Verses are with Rapture read,
line_2: They ne'er could spring from his poor Baby Head.

line_1: They ne'er could spring from his poor Baby Head.
line_2: Howe'er his Verses are with Rapture read,

line_1: No, no, dear Rose, his Tricks are too well known;
line_2: They are his Mother's Verses, not his own.

line_1: They are his Mother's Verses, not his own.
line_2: No, no, dear Rose, his Tricks are too well known;

line_1: Presumptuous Youth! this dang'rous Art forbear;
line_2: Nor tempt a Character beyond thy Sphere.

line_1: Nor tempt a Character beyond thy Sphere.
line_2: Presumptuous Youth! this dang'rous Art forbear;

line_1: Let meaner Flames thy tender Breast inspire;
line_2: Touch not a Beam of hers — 'Tis sacred Fire!

line_1: Touch not a Beam of hers — 'Tis sacred Fire!
line_2: Let meaner Flames thy tender Breast inspire;

line_1: Phoebus might trust thy Mother with his Sun;
line_2: But you, fond Boy, may prove a Phaeton.

line_1: But you, fond Boy, may prove a Phaeton.
line_2: Phoebus might trust thy Mother with his Sun;
